fullText: The show's greatest strength is its extraordinary cast, who bring nuance and depth to characters that might otherwise feel underwritten in Conor McPherson's Depression-era drama.
dtliExcerpt: The show's greatest strength is its extraordinary cast, who bring nuance and depth to characters that might otherwise feel underwritten in Conor McPherson's Depression-era drama.
bwwExcerpt: I was a bit less taken with the Broadway production at the lovely old Belasco Theatre. Winningham remains magnetic; the new cast members are strong, especially Sanders and Scott, and the singing is as beautiful as ever. (Bayardelle sends the audience out on a high note.) But I was more acutely aware this time of how thinly the story is stretched; the gloominess felt heavier, and the enigmatic nature of Dylan's lyrics-which often relate only obliquely to the action-kept me at a distance. There are shows, like places, that you want to revisit again and again. But the chill I admired in Girl from the North Country left me somewhat colder the second time around.
